sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"倾斜"之意。
means: tip ： 指向一边倾斜或向上翻转、失去平衡或完全翻转过来。
slope ： 指向上或向下渐渐倾斜的表面，多用于山、屋顶等缓缓倾斜。
tilt ： 指有意识地或长时间地使物体处于倾斜状态。

word_mean: 岩体、土体在自然重力作用或人为作用而形成一定倾斜度的临空面。

sentence.Network_en: He wonders why the digits on his calculator slope to the right.
sentence.Network_cn: 他不明白为什么他的计算器上面的数字向右倾斜。

sentence.Network_en: Suddenly I was cartwheeling down the slope, all orientation gone.
sentence.Network_cn: 突然，我骨碌碌地滚下坡，完全晕头转向了。

sentence.Network_en: From the slope below, the wild goats bleated faintly.
sentence.Network_cn: 山坡下面，野山羊咩咩地轻声叫着。

jx.jx_en_mean: (Military)(of a rifle) held with the barrel on the left shoulder and the butt in the left hand
(informal)leave unobtrusively, typically in order to evade work or duty
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)悄悄溜走（尤指逃避工作或值班）

lj.lj_ly: the men sloped off looking ashamed of themselves.
lj.lj_ls: 那些人悄悄溜走了，满脸羞愧的样子。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (as a verb): from the obsolete adverb slope, a shortening of aslope. The use of the verb with reference to aimless or unobtrusive movement may be related to lope

entry.def: A slope is the side of a mountain, hill, or valley.

example.ex: Saint-Christo is perched on a mountain slope.
example.tran: 圣克里斯托教堂坐落在一个山坡上。
喜马拉雅山脉较低处的山坡

entry.def: A slope is a surface that is at an angle, so that one end is higher than the other.

example.ex: The street must have been on a slope.
example.tran: 这条街一定是建在一个斜坡上。

entry.def: If a surface slopes, it is at an angle, so that one end is higher than the other.

example.ex: The bank sloped down sharply to the river...
example.tran: 河岸到河面的斜坡非常陡。

entry.def: If something slopes, it leans to the right or to the left rather than being upright.

example.ex: He wonders why the digits on his calculator slope to the right.
example.tran: 他不明白为什么他的计算器上面的数字向右倾斜。

entry.def: The slope of something is the angle at which it slopes.

example.ex: The slope increases as you go up the curve.
example.tran: 上了弯道以后，路越来越陡。
一段坡度为 10° 的斜坡

entry.def: If someone slopes into or out of a place, they enter or leave it quickly and quietly, especially because they are trying to avoid or escape something.

example.ex: She sloped off quietly on Saturday afternoon...
example.tran: 星期六下午，她脚底抹油，溜之大吉。

example.ex: They sloped into their hotel at 6am.
example.tran: 凌晨 6 点，他们悄悄地潜入他们下榻的饭店。

sentences.sentence: "the house was built on the side of the mountain"

means.word_mean: 2. the property possessed by a line or surface that departs from the horizontal;

auth_sentence.content: He increased his speed, scrambling up the slope.
auth_sentence.res_content: He increased his speed, scrambling up the slope.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He increased his speed, scrambling up the slope.

auth_sentence.content: Its a slippery slope argument, that's all.
auth_sentence.res_content: Its a slippery slope argument, that's all.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Its a slippery slope argument, that's all.

auth_sentence.content: Princess dresses are the slippery slope to Paris Hilton.
auth_sentence.res_content: Princess dresses are the slippery slope to Paris Hilton.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Princess dresses are the slippery slope to Paris Hilton.

Sentence.sentence: This slippery slope of eroding ethics and bigger risks leads only to disaster.

sentences.en: On both slopes of the roof there are broken tiles.
sentences.cn: 屋顶的两面斜面都有破瓦片。

means.word_mean: 倾斜, 坡度, 斜率

sentences.en: The floor is on a slight slope.

sentences.cn: 地板在这儿倾斜得很厉害。

jushi.english: On both slopes of the roof, there are broken tiles.
jushi.chinese: 屋顶的两面斜面都有破瓦片。

jushi.english: The floor is on a slight slope.
She climbed the slippery slope with difficulty to search for herbs.
jushi.chinese: 她艰难地爬上滑坡寻找草药。
